body.raw:
{
    "language": "python",
    "question_title": "Reverse Integer",
    "question_statement": "Given a signed 32-bit integer x, return x with its digits reversed. If reversing x causes the value to go outside the signed 32-bit integer range [-231, 231 - 1], then return 0. Assume the environment does not allow you to store 64-bit integers (signed or unsigned).",
    "ref_program": "def reverse(x):\n\tans = 0\n\twhile x != 0:\n\t\tans = ans * 10 + x % 10\n\t\tx //= 10\n\n\tif ans > 2**31 - 1 or ans < -(2**31):\n\t\treturn 0\n\n\treturn ans",
    "due_date": "2024-04-27",
    "test_cases": [
        {"input": "123",
        "output": "321"},
        {"input": "-123",
        "output": "-321"},
        {"input": "120",
        "output": "21"},
        {"input": "9990",
        "output": "999"}
    ]
}

formdata.value:
def intToRoman(num):
    listado_unidad = ["", "I", "II", "III", "IV", "V", "VI", "VII", "VIII", "IX"]
    listado_decena = ["", "X", "XX", "XXX", "XL", "L", "LX", "LXX", "LXXX", "XC"]
    listado_centena = ["", "C", "CC", "CCC", "CD", "D", "DC", "DCC", "DCCC", "CM"]
    listado_millar = ["", "M", "MM", "MMM"]

    millar = num // 1000
    centena = (num % 1000) // 100
    decena = (num % 100) // 10
    unidad = num % 10

    millar_romano = listado_millar[millar]
    centena_romano = listado_centena[centena]
    decena_romano = listado_decena[decena]
    unidad_romano = listado_unidad[unidad]

    return millar_romano + centena_romano + decena_romano + unidad_romano
